qas.question: What is the name of the hat that the pope used to wear when naming a new Cardinal?
In what year did the practice of donning this item stop?
What does the pope now wear when naming a new Cardinal?
What was the name of the hat bestowed upon a pope upon his naming?

plausible_answers.text: bestow upon him a distinctive wide-brimmed hat

qas.question: What do cardinals not have the right to display in their cathedral?

plausible_answers.text: it would be suspended from the ceiling above his tomb.

qas.question: What would happen to a pope's gelero when he dies?
What is officially part of a cardinals apparel?

context: In previous times, at the consistory at which the pope named a new cardinal, he would <b4_0>bestow upon him a distinctive wide-brimmed hat<b4_0/> called <a0_0>a <b3_0>galero<b3_0/>.<a0_0/> This custom was discontinued in <a1_0>1969<a1_0/> and the investiture now takes place with the <a2_0>scarlet biretta<a2_0/>. In ecclesiastical heraldry, however, the scarlet galero is still displayed on the cardinal's coat of arms. Cardinals had the right to display the <b5_0>galero<b5_0/> in their cathedral, and when a cardinal died, <b6_0>it would be suspended from the ceiling above his tomb.<b6_0/> Some cardinals will still have a <b7_0>galero<b7_0/> made, even though it is not officially part of their apparel.[citation needed]
